content: - Good News Study Bible - Notes Material
At once the Spirit made him go into the desert,

where he stayed 40 days, being
tempted by Satan. Wild animals were there also, but angels came and helped him.

Jesus returns to Galilee and does not go back to Judea until the close of his public
ministry. There is no indication of how long his Galilean ministry lasted: only when he is
back in Judea is a
Jesus' message is about the arrival of the

, which will happen soon.
To prepare for it, the people need to repent (1.15). He immediately summons two pairs of
fishermen brothers to be his followers and helpers.

After John had been put in prison, Jesus went to Galilee and preached the Good News
from God.
